byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume reported from Paris, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.
byline.original: By MAÏA de la BAUME and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

abstract: French special forces commandos raid terrorist camp in northern Mali and rescue Dutch citizen Sjaak Rijke, who had been held hostage in Sahara for over three years by Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb.
lead_paragraph: Seized more than three years ago in Timbuktu by the North African branch of Al Qaeda, the man was freed from a terrorist camp in northern Mali.

headline.main: French Commando Raid in Mali Frees Dutch Captive
headline.print_headline: French Commandos Free Dutchman Held by Al Qaeda’s North African Branch

snippet: Seized more than three years ago in Timbuktu by the North African branch of Al Qaeda, the man was freed from a terrorist camp in northern Mali.

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
keywords.name: organizations
